poem:
The Search for Mother

Beneath the Dorset soil,  
she sleeps in rusted repose—  
a relic of iron whispers  
from war's distant past.  
Forgotten by time, but not by story,  
her treads echo the earth's dream  
of the clanking battles,  
a mystery silent yet wondrous,  
waiting to rise through  
the mist of armored history.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘A wonderful mystery to be solved’: Search begins in Dorset for ‘the Mother of all tanks’ At the height of the second world war, while British authorities were calling on citizens to donate metal to be recycled into weapons and warships, attention at the army base of Bovington Camp in Dorset turned to a collection of historic vehicles dating from the first war – among them a legendary tank that had been nicknamed “Mother”. Mother". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘A wonderful mystery to be solved’: Search begins in Dorset for ‘the Mother of all tanks’ At the height of the second world war, while British authorities were calling on citizens to donate metal to be recycled into weapons and warships, attention at the army base of Bovington Camp in Dorset turned to a collection of historic vehicles dating from the first war – among them a legendary tank that had been nicknamed “Mother”. Mother
